CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.TY_TYPE_BID: Submission for one or more lots

ML_TI_DOC.TI_CY: Dik li kienet ir-Repubblika Jugoslava tal-Maċedonja

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Directorate of Compulsory Reserves of Oil and Oil Derivatives

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Directorate of Compulsory Reserves of Oil and Oil Derivatives
Directorate for Compulsory Reserves of Oil and Oil Derivatives

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Supply of property insurance services for a period of one year

LOCATION.P: On the territory of the Republic of Macedonia.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Supply of property insurance services for a period of one year, consisting of:
— Lot No.1: Insurance of the stocks of oil derivatives from the compulsory reserves of the Republic of Macedonia on flotant basis and insurance of movable property - equipment of DCOR, and,
— Lot No. 2: Insurance of DCOR’s motor vehicles from automobile liability for damages caused to third parties and Full Motor Vehicle Insurance (Casco).

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Lot No.1: Insurance of the stocks of oil derivatives from the compulsory reserves of the Republic of Macedonia on flotant basis and insurance of movable property - equipment of DCOR.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION_ABOUT_LOTS.P: More information on Lot No. 1 contained in the technical specification part of the tender documentation. Tender documentation can be downloaded by any interested bidder from the following webpage: http://bjn.gov.mk or (https://www.e-nabavki.gov.mk) Notice No.01/2018 dated 7.2.2018 published by DCOR as contracting authority.

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Lot No. 2: Insurance of DCOR’s motor vehicles from automobile liability for damages caused to third parties and Full Motor Vehicle Insurance (Casco)

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION_ABOUT_LOTS.P: More information on Lot No. 2 contained in the technical specification part of the tender documentation. Tender documentation can be downloaded by any interested bidder from the following web page:
Notice No.01/2018 dated 7.2.2018 published by DCOR as contracting authority.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: 1) Statement about the steadiness of the offer;
2) Performance guarantee (5 % of the total contract value)

— in order to sign the contract with the selected most favorable economic operator, the successful bidder shall be required to provide a contract performance bank guarantee in the amount of 5 % of the contract value.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: More information contained in the tender documentation.

LEGAL_FORM.P: A group of economic operators shall have the right to submit a bid without an obligation to form any legally appropriate association. The contracting authority shall not require the group of bidders to be associated in an appropriate legal form if the group is selected as the carrier of the procurement.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: 1) For proving personal status, the economic operator should provide the following documents:

— statement by the economic operator that in the previous 5 years, an effective court decision for participation in a criminal organisation, corruption, fraud or money laundering, has not been announced,
— a certificate that it is not subject to bankruptcy procedure issued by a competent authority,
— a certificate that it is not subject to liquidation procedure issued by a competent authority,
— a certificate for paid taxes, contributions and other public duties by the competent authority in the country where that economic operator is established,

— a certificate from the Register of penalties for criminal acts committed by legal entities that a secondary penalty ban on participation in procedures for public announcement, the award of public supply contracts and public-private partnership, has not been imposed,

— a certificate from the Register of penalties for criminal acts committed by legal entities that a secondary penalty temporary or permanent prohibition of certain activities has not been imposed and,

— a certificate that a sanction for a misdemeanor with an effective court decision, resulting in prohibition for pursuing professional activity or duty, i.e. temporary prohibition for performing a professional activity, it is not being announced.

2) Document for registered activity - A document for a registered activity as a proof that the operator is registered as a natural person or a legal entity to perform an activity related to the public procurement contract or proof of membership in an appropriate professional association in accordance with the regulations of the country where the operator is registered,
Economic operator shall prove the fulfillment of special requirements for performing activity prescribed in accordance with the law by submitting the following document:

— valid license for performing insurance activities in the respective classes of insurance (for Lot No. 1 - classes of insurance 7,8 and 9 and for Lot No.2 - classes of insurance 3 and 10) that is subject to public procurement, according to the Law on Insurance Supervision (" Official Gazette of the Republic of Macedonia" No. 27/02, 84/02 ........... 192/15 and 23/16) issued by a competent authority.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Necessary documents for economic and financial ability of the economic operator:
The economic operator shall prove the fulfillment of the minimum requirements by submitting the following documents:
— report from the Insurance Supervision Agency of the Republic of Macedonia for 2016,

EAF_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: — the economic operator has had realized minimum 600,000,000.00 MKD gross written premium for 2016 (in case the bid refers only to Lot No. 1 or to both Lots No.1 and No.2),
— the economic operator has had realized minimum 150 000 000,00 MKD gross written premium for 2016 (in case the bid refers only to Lot No.2),
— to have positive financial results form the operation in 2016.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Necessary documents for technical or professional ability of the economic operator:
— evidence from a competent authority or a rating agency for the rating of the reinsurance company,,

— copy of the reinsurance contract with the first reinsurer with a minimum "A" credit rating determined by Standard and Poor's or equivalent with validity for 2018 (for foreign acts a translation from.
— providing "Insurance Conditions" (General and Specific) for the concrete procurement,

— a list of provided property insurance services to legal entities in the last three years, with values, dates, buyers (contracting authorities and economic operators), and providing at least three (3) statements for the provided services issued by the recipients or providing a copy of at least three (3) contracts for insurance of property and movables of legal entities for the previous year, with an individual value of the contracts not less than 1.500.000,00 MKD (in case the bid refers only to Lot No.1 or to both Lots No.1 and No.2), or providing a copy of at least three (3) contracts for insurance of motor vehicles for the previous year, with an individual value of the contracts not less than 250.000,00 MKD (in case the bid refers only to Lot No. 2),
— statement for the amount of the highest paid damages in the last three years, per year (2015, 2016, 2017),
— a statement that the economic operator has engaged professional person qualified to assess the damages adequate to the concrete procurement,
— notification on the elements of the contract which the economic operator intends to subcontract to third parties (if necessary).

T_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: — 100 % reinsurance of the stocks of the compulsory oil reserves subject to the public procurement contract,
— having reinsurance coverage from a reinsurance company which has a minimum credit rating of "A" fixed by Standard and Poor's or equivalent,
— in the last three years having performed an insurance services for the same or similar risks for at least three legal entities,
— having engaged (with an employment contract or other agreement) professional personnel qualified to assess the damages of the respective public procurement.

EXECUTION_SERVICE_RESERVED_PARTICULAR_PR.P: Holding license for providing insurance services (as well registration for the following classes of insurance:
— Lot No.1 - classes of insurance 7, 8 and 9,

— Lot No 2 - classes of insurance 3 and 10 - under provisions of the Law on Insurance Supervision (Official Gazette of the Republic of Macedonia no. 27/02,79/07, 67/10, 44/11, 112/11,188/13, 112/14, 153/15, 192/15 and 23/16).

USE_ELECTRONIC_AUCTION.P: More information on electronic auction contained in the tender documentation.

For each part/lot subject of the public procurement contract, a separate electronic auction through electronic procurement system (https://www.e-nabavki.gov.mk) will be conducted. Subject to any auction will be the total cost of the service (the amount of insurance premium) including all costs and discounts without VAT, for each lot/part subject of the public procurement contract.

LANGUAGE_OTHER.P: Tender documentation is available only in Macedonian language. The bid, as well as the complete correspondence and documents related to the bid should be submitted in Macedonian language.
Tender documentation could be obtained at the following link:

PLACE_NOT_STRUCTURED.P: Directorate of Compulsory Reserves of Oil and Oil Derivatives, Orce Nikolov street, No.71, 1000 Skopje, Republic of Macedonia

EXISTENCE_AUTHORISED_PERSONS.P: Any interested person can attend the public bid opening on 27.2.2018 (at 11:00 local time). Only the authorized representatives of the bidders can participate in the procedure of the public bid opening by providing their comments in the minutes of the bid opening:

— the authorized representatives of the bidders shall bring with them to the public opening an authorization (PoA) signed by a responsible person of the bidder. All authorized representatives of bidders, present at the public opening, should sign an attendance list.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: Tender documentation can be downloaded by any interested bidder from the following webpage:
Notice No.01/2018 dated 7.2.2018 published by DCOR as contracting authority,

The bid for the above subject of the public procurement contract (for Lot No. 1 and Lot No.2) should be submitted no later than 27.2.2018 at 11:00 (local time) exclusively through the ESPP (https://www.e-nabavki.gov.mk), following the instructions given in the "EPPS Use Manual" published on the same web address in the section "Economic operators".

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: State Appeals Commission for Public Procurement

LODGING_OF_APPEALS_PRECISION.P: Precise information on deadline(s) for lodging appeals: Article 216 (Public Procurement Law - Official Gazette of:
